news.title: Trump's trade war shift away from Chinese manufacturing has reached tipping point
news.description: A long-term supply chain shift is pulling the rest of Asia even with manufacturing giant China. For importers, a short-term cash crunch from tariffs is looming.

news.title: Stock futures are little changed after Wall Street notches back-to-back winning weeks: Live updates
news.description: The three major indexes are coming off their second straight winning weeks.

news.title: Beef prices are soaring. Here's why America is facing record-low cattle numbers
news.description: Beef prices are up about 15% over the past year as ranchers face record low cattle herds amidst years of drought throughout U.S. farmlands.

news.title: Berkshire Hathaway is on track to lag behind the S&P 500 in Buffett's last year as CEO
news.description: With less than a month to go, Berkshire Hathaway's B shares are behind the S&P in their 2025 race. With dividends included, the S&P's lead is even bigger.

news.title: Asia-Pacific markets trade mostly higher as investors look toward China trade data
news.description: Asia-Pacific markets traded mostly higher on Monday as investors look toward trade data coming out of China later in the day.

news.title: Huge Wall Street call: Morgan Stanley's new Tesla analyst downgrades stock over valuation concerns
news.description: The analyst downgraded Tesla's stock to equal weight from overweight.

news.title: Ukraine peace deal is really close, U.S. envoy Kellogg says
news.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's outgoing Ukraine envoy said a deal to end the Ukraine war now depended on resolving two main outstanding issues.

news.title: Chinese internet companies are ramping AI spending. These local players may benefit
news.description: Chinese internet companies increasingly say they don't have enough compute to power their artificial intelligence ambitions.

news.title: Global week ahead: Fed's December decision to inform world's central banks
news.description: The Federal Reserve is expected to cut rates this week, setting the scene for other central banks' final policy meetings for 2025.

news.title: Trump administration waives $11 million fine for Southwest Airlines' 2022 holiday meltdown
news.description: The Trump administration said it will forgive the last $11 million of a fine against Southwest Airlines that stems from the carrier's 2022 holiday meltdown.

news.title: SpaceX aims for $800 billion valuation in secondary share sale, WSJ reports
news.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX is reportedly launching an insider share sale that could value the company as high as $800 billion.

news.title: Meta acquiring AI wearable company Limitless
news.description: Meta has acquired the startup Limitless, which makes a small, artificial intelligence-powered pendant.

news.title: Supreme Court to hear case on Trump birthright citizenship order
news.description: The U.S. Constitution's 14th Amendment had been understood to grant citizenship to children born in the country, even if their parents are not citizens.

news.title: Jan. 6 pipe bomb suspect Brian Cole confessed, said he supports Trump and has anarchist views: MS NOW
news.description: Cole spoke to the authorities for "more than four hours" after his arrest, the government told a judge during the suspect's initial court appearance.

news.title: David Ellison's hunt for WBD made David Zaslav richer — and it may not be over
news.description: Paramount is considering taking an offer to WBD shareholders, thinking its deal has a better chance of gaining regulatory approval than Netflix's, sources said.

news.title: Bessent says U.S. will finish the year with 3% GDP growth, sees 'very strong' holiday season
news.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the economy will end the year on strong footing and said the president was disappointed in economic coverage in the media.

news.title: Core inflation rate watched by Fed hit 2.8%, delayed September data shows, lower than expected
news.description: The delayed core personal consumption expenditures price index for September was expected to show a 2.9% annual increase.

news.title: Layoff announcements top 1.1 million this year, the most since 2020 pandemic, Challenger says
news.description: The firm said layoff plans totaled  71,321 in November, a step down from October but still enough to bring the 2025 total up to 1.17 million.

news.title: Ukraine, trade, pandas: What China's Xi and France's Macron discussed in Beijing
news.description: China said it is open to importing more high-quality goods from France while urging a "fair, conducive environment" for Chinese businesses in the European nation.

news.title: Bessent says Trump admin will be able to replicate tariffs even if it loses Supreme Court decision
news.description: The Treasury secretary cited several sections of 1962 Trade Act that give the president sweeping powers over import duties.

news.title: November private payrolls unexpectedly fell by 32,000, led by steep small business job cuts, ADP reports
news.description: The payrolls decline marked a sharp step down from October, which saw an upwardly revised gain of 47,000 positions.

news.title: Married millennials, here comes the crypto divorce cliff
news.description: Millennials hold more crypto than any other Americans and are nearing peak divorce years. Many married couples, and the legal system, are not prepared.

news.title: Week in review: Stocks rise, Meta gets real on metaverse, and Salesforce bounces
news.description: Stocks eked out gains Friday and closed the week higher.

news.title: 'Terrifying': Why U.S. senator in top intel post wants more spying on Chinese companies
news.description: Chinese biotech BGI will pass Huawei in scale and threat, says Sen. Mark Warner. 'It's terrifying,' he said at CNBC event, pushing for more corporate spying.

news.title: Why your crypto wealth may never make it to the next generation
news.description: Crypto investors face a wide range of estate planning issues that could leave digital assets tied up in court or lost forever rather than passed to heirs.

news.title: The UK wants to unlock a 'golden age of nuclear' but faces key challenges in reviving historic lead
news.description: Geopolitics and the energy transition has pushed nuclear energy back onto public agendas.

news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says he has divested his soybean farm
news.description: The New York Times has reported that Secretary Bessent owned as much as $25 million of soybean and corn farmland in North Dakota.
